meanings.definition: Impossible to pass through or enter
meanings.sent1: The thick walls of the fortress were impenetrable to the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The dense jungle was so impenetrable that even the bravest explorers hesitated to enter.
meanings.sent3: The mystery novel had an impenetrable plot twist that left readers guessing until the very end.
meanings.sent4: Her stoic expression was like an impenetrable mask, hiding her true emotions from everyone.
meanings.sent5: The fog was so impenetrable that it felt like walking through a wall of white cotton.

meanings.definition: Not able to be understood or overcome
meanings.sent1: The professor's lecture on quantum physics was impenetrable to most of the students.
meanings.sent2: The language barrier made the instructions impenetrable to the foreign visitors.
meanings.sent3: Trying to decipher his handwriting was like facing an impenetrable code.
meanings.sent4: The complexity of the legal jargon created an impenetrable barrier for the average person.
meanings.sent5: The dense fog of confusion surrounding the topic made it impenetrable to even the experts.
